title: Xiumin
text:
Kim Min-seok (born ), better known by his stage name Xiumin (; ), is a South Korean singer and actor. He is best known as a member of the South Korean-Chinese boy band <a href="Exo">Exo</a>, its sub-group Exo-M and its sub-unit <a href="Exo-CBX">Exo-CBX</a>.
Name.
His stage name is a combination of the Chinese reading of <a href="Hanja">hanja</a> characters 秀 (xiù), which means great or show, and 珉 (mín) which is part of his birth name.
Life and career.
1990–2013: Early life and career beginnings.
Xiumin was born on March 26, 1990 in <a href="Seoul">Seoul</a> and grew up in <a href="Gyuri">Gyuri</a>, <a href="Gyeonggi%20Province">Gyeonggi Province</a>. He was a student at <a href="Catholic%20Kwandong%20University">Catholic Kwandong University</a> where he attended a seminar and gave a presentation for students in Applied Music. Xiumin learned martial arts and has a black belt in <a href="Kendo">Kendo</a> and <a href="Taekwondo">Taekwondo</a>. He also trained in <a href="Wushu%20%28sport%29">Wushu</a> and <a href="Fencing">Fencing</a>. Xiumin is also known as an avid fan of <a href="association%20football">football</a>, and is an honorary ambassador of the <a href="Korea%20Football%20Association">Korea Football Association</a>.
Before Xiumin's participation in SM's Everysing Contest, he had auditioned for <a href="JYP%20Entertainment">JYP entertainment</a> in 2008 but was rejected.
In 2008, Xiumin won second place in the SM Everysing Contest. He later became a trainee through SM Entertainment's Casting System in the same year.
Xiumin was revealed as the seventh member of South Korean-Chinese boy group <a href="Exo">Exo</a> in January 2012. The group debuted on April 8, 2012. In 2013, Xiumin made a guest appearance alongside actress <a href="Kim%20Yoo-jung">Kim Yoo-jung</a> in the music video for the song "Gone" by South Korean singer Jin, now a member of <a href="Lovelyz">Lovelyz</a>.
2015–present: Acting roles and Exo-CBX.
In January 2015, Xiumin made his musical theatre debut, playing the character of Aquila in the SM Entertainment musical "School OZ" alongside labelmates <a href="Changmin">Changmin</a>, <a href="Key%20%28singer%29">Key</a>, <a href="Luna%20%28singer%29">Luna</a>, <a href="Suho%20%28Singer%29">Suho</a> and <a href="Kang%20Seul-gi">Seulgi</a>. In October 2015, Xiumin played the leading role opposite actress <a href="Kim%20So-eun">Kim So-eun</a> in the web drama "<a href="Falling%20for%20Challenge">Falling for Challenge</a>". He also released his first solo song since debut titled "You Are the One" as a soundtrack of the web drama. "Falling for Challenge" was the most watched web drama in South Korea in 2015, reaching 20 million views just after 17 days.
In February 2016, Xiumin was featured in <a href="AOA%20%28band%29">AOA</a> member <a href="Shin%20Ji-min">Jimin</a>'s solo single "Call You Bae", and appeared in its music video. In July 2016, he made his big screen debut alongside <a href="Yoo%20Seung-ho">Yoo Seung-ho</a> in the South Korean film '. In August 2016, he collaborated with fellow Exo members <a href="Chen%20%28singer%29">Chen</a>, and <a href="Byun%20Baek-hyun">Baekhyun</a> on an original soundtrack titled "For You" for the television series '. In October 2016, together with Chen and Baekhyun, Xiumin became a member of <a href="Exo">Exo</a>'s first official sub unit <a href="Exo-CBX">Exo-CBX</a>. The group made their debut with the <a href="extended%20play">extended play</a> "<a href="Hey%20Mama%21">Hey Mama!</a>" on October 31.
In July 2017, Xiumin collaborated with <a href="NCT%20%28band%29">NCT</a> member <a href="Mark%20Lee%20%28singer%29">Mark</a> on a single titled "<a href="Young%20%26amp%3B%20Free%20%28Xiumin%20and%20Mark%20song%29">Young & Free</a>" for S.M. Entertainment's digital music project <a href="SM%20Station">Station</a>. In August, he became a regular cast member on the <a href="Munhwa%20Broadcasting%20Corporation">MBC</a> reality TV show "<a href="It%27s%20Dangerous%20Beyond%20The%20Blankets">It's Dangerous Beyond The Blankets</a>".
Xiumin enlisted for his <a href="conscription%20in%20South%20Korea">mandatory military service</a> on May 7, 2019, serving active duty. He performed his final concerts before his enlistment with Exo-CBX's Magical Circus - Special Edition concert in Japan, and his solo fan meeting concert, Xiuweet Time, at <a href="Jamsil%20Arena">Jamsil Arena</a> on May 4. Following his enlistment, he released his debut solo single, "You", which is part of SM Station, on May 9. In August 2019, it was reported that Xiumin would be starring in an army musical titled "Return: The Promise of That Day" together with <a href="Shinee">Shinee</a> member <a href="Onew">Onew</a> and <a href="Yoon%20Ji-sung">Yoon Ji-sung</a>, which ran from October 22 to December 1 at the Olympic Park’s Woori Art Hall in Seoul. Xiumin took his final military leave in November 2020, and did not return to the army due to the military's policy on <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19</a>; he was discharged on December 6.
